meanings.sent1: The machine will eject the coins when you press the button.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to eject the USB drive safely before removing it from the computer.
meanings.sent3: The toaster decided to eject the burnt toast like a tiny catapult.
meanings.sent4: His anger seemed to build up inside him until it finally erupted and he ejected harsh words.
meanings.sent5: The volcano's eruption was so powerful that it could eject rocks high into the sky.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to eject the disruptive student from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: When you sneeze, your body will naturally eject any irritants from your nose.
meanings.sent3: The balloon seemed to eject air with a funny squeaky sound.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing river threatened to eject debris onto the nearby fields.
meanings.sent5: The spaceship's emergency system could eject the crew safely in case of danger.

meanings.sent1: To clean the printer, you need to eject the paper tray and wipe it gently.
meanings.sent2: The pilot had to quickly eject from the plane before it crashed.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a box that could mysteriously eject objects.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind could eject sand particles into the air, creating a dusty haze.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to eject the faulty part and replace it with a new one.
